lead_paragraph: A report by the Social Security Administration’s inspector general concludes that virtually all of the payments were proper under policies in place at the time.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Paid Residents Linked to Nazi Crimes $20 Million in Benefits, Report Says
headline.main: U.S. Paid Residents Linked to Nazi Crimes $20 Million in Benefits, Report Says

snippet: A report by the Social Security Administration’s inspector general concludes that virtually all of the payments were proper under policies in place at the time.
abstract: Federal investigation reveals American government paid $20.2 million in Social Security benefits to more than 130 United States residents linked to Nazi atrocities over period of fifty years; payments point to ease with which former Nazis were able to find new lives in United States following World War II.
